modName: Requiem - Raw Food Fix For Custom Races - Strong Stomach is Strong
summary: In Requiem mod, custom beast races are affected by raw food just as bad as non-beast races, while vanilla beast races were OK with raw food, this fix removes this issue!
descriptionHtml:
[b]TL;DR[/b]
Just like vanilla beast races, after installation of this fix, custom beast races in Requiem won't receive negative effects of raw food any longer (assuming you use a proper Requiem custom race patch).

[b]Longer, but read anyway:[/b]
When you add your custom beast race to Requiem and even use a proper race patch, you still cannot eat raw food without losing stamina. That happens due to the way Requiem is coded, but thanksfully the issue wasn't too difficult to fix.
Now the req_strongstomach keyword, which is recommended to use in custom beast race patches but never helped with the issue, is finally working with my fix!

The description of raw food is now changed to reflect the change this fix implements - from now on, the descritpion doesn't only mention Orcs, Argonians, Khajiit and Woodelves as in vanilla Requiem, but "anyone whose race is known for strong stomach" as well!

I tested the fix with both Lykaios (new custom race) and the vanilla Nord race. The three tested foods: potato, venison and bestial stew are now having proper effect on the respective races.

[b]Requirements:[/b]
Link to custom race patches for Requiem (required for obvious reasons):
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58145/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58145/?[/url]

Link to Requiem (required for even more obvious reasons):
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?[/url]

[b]Installation:[/b]
This is a simple .esp file, put it into your "data" folder.
Put this plugin [b]after [/b]Requiem in your loading order!
author: Cossack-HD
